Class Contact

  • java.lang.Object
    • Contact

  • public class Contact
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a contact which could be found in an address book. It holds a first name, a last name, and a phone number.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Justin Bertrand

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Contact()
      Default constructor which passes unknown to the previous constructor.
      Contact(java.lang.String first, java.lang.String last, java.lang.String phone)
      Constructor which takes a first name, last name and phone number.

        Constructor which takes a first name, last name and phone number.
        Parameters:
        first - The first name of the contact.
        last - The last name of the contact.
        phone - The contacts phone number.

        ValidationException - Throws a ValidationException if parameters contain whitespace, are null, are empty, are too long, or contain a comma.

        Parameters:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String of the first name, last name, and phone number, all seperated by commas.
        See Also:
        Returns a string of all the information of the contact in the form of a comma seperated value(CSV). Ex: firstName,lastName,phoneNumber
